entries.title: Lawsuit Claims TikTok Violates Pennsylvania Wiretapping and Surveillance Rules
entries.description: In this photo illustration, the download page for the TikTok app is displayed on an Apple iPhone in Washington on Aug. 7, 2020. (Drew Angerer/Getty Images)

entries.title: Scammers Steal Huge Food Shipments Using Online Technique Agencies Describe as ‘Most Financially Damaging’
entries.description: An engineering student takes part in a hacking challenge near Paris, on Mar. 16, 2013. (Thomas Samson/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Elon Musk Breaks Silence After Poll Votes in Favor of His Resignation as Twitter CEO
entries.description: Elon Musk's Twitter profile on a smartphone placed on printed Twitter logos on April 28, 2022. (Dado Ruvic/Illustration/Reuters)

entries.title: ‘Fortnite’ Maker Epic Games Fined $520 Million Over Claims It Violated Children’s Privacy, Collected Personal Data
entries.description: The Epic Games logo, maker of the popular video game "Fortnite", is pictured on a screen in this picture illustration on Aug. 14, 2020. (Brendan McDermid/Illustration/Reuters)

entries.title: FBI’s Suppression of Speech on Twitter Calls for Congressional Investigation: Analysts
entries.description: Marc Ruskin, retired FBI Special Agent and author of "The Pretender," in New York on Oct. 4, 2019. (Samira Bouaou/The Epoch Times)
